trans-unit.source: A new insert script is registered that generates an SAS when a new Todo item is inserted.
trans-unit.target: A new insert script is registered that generates an SAS when a new Todo item is inserted.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't yet created your storage account, see <linkText>How To Create a Storage Account</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't yet created your storage account, see <linkText>How To Create a Storage Account</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Storage, click the storage account, then click Manage Keys.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Storage, click the storage account, then click Manage Keys.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the Storage Account Name and Access Key.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the Storage Account Name and Access Key.

trans-unit.source: In your mobile service, click the Configure tab, scroll down to App settings and enter a Name and Value pair for each of the following that you obtained from the storage account, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: In your mobile service, click the Configure tab, scroll down to App settings and enter a Name and Value pair for each of the following that you obtained from the storage account, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: STORAGE_ACCOUNT_NAME
trans-unit.target: STORAGE_ACCOUNT_NAME

trans-unit.source: STORAGE_ACCOUNT_ACCESS_KEY
trans-unit.target: STORAGE_ACCOUNT_ACCESS_KEY

trans-unit.source: The storage account access key is stored encrypted in app settings.
trans-unit.target: The storage account access key is stored encrypted in app settings.

trans-unit.source: You can access this key from any server script at runtime.
trans-unit.target: You can access this key from any server script at runtime.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [App settings].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [App settings].

trans-unit.source: In the Configure tab, make sure that <linkText>Dynamic schema</linkText><title></title> is enabled.
trans-unit.target: In the Configure tab, make sure that <linkText>Dynamic schema</linkText><title></title> is enabled.

trans-unit.source: You need dynamic schema enabled to be able to add new columns to the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: You need dynamic schema enabled to be able to add new columns to the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Dynamic schema should not be enabled in any production service.
trans-unit.target: Dynamic schema should not be enabled in any production service.

trans-unit.source: Click the Data tab and then click the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Click the Data tab and then click the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: In todoitem, click the Script tab and select Insert, replace the insert function with the following code, then click Save:
trans-unit.target: In todoitem, click the Script tab and select Insert, replace the insert function with the following code, then click Save:

trans-unit.source: This replaces the function that is invoked when an insert occurs in the TodoItem table with a new script.
trans-unit.target: This replaces the function that is invoked when an insert occurs in the TodoItem table with a new script.

trans-unit.source: This new script generates a new SAS for the insert, which is valid for 5 minutes, and assigns the value of the generated SAS to the sasQueryString property of the returned item.
trans-unit.target: This new script generates a new SAS for the insert, which is valid for 5 minutes, and assigns the value of the generated SAS to the sasQueryString property of the returned item.

trans-unit.source: The imageUri property is also set to the resource path of the new BLOB to enable image display during binding in the client UI.
trans-unit.target: The imageUri property is also set to the resource path of the new BLOB to enable image display during binding in the client UI.

trans-unit.source: This code creates an SAS for an individual BLOB. If you need to upload multiple blobs to a container using the same SAS, you can instead call the generateSharedAccessSignature method with an empty blob resource name, like this:
trans-unit.target: This code creates an SAS for an individual BLOB. If you need to upload multiple blobs to a container using the same SAS, you can instead call the generateSharedAccessSignature method with an empty blob resource name, like this:

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the quickstart app to add image upload functionality by using the SAS generated on insert.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the quickstart app to add image upload functionality by using the SAS generated on insert.

trans-unit.target: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/b6bb7d2d-35ae-47eb-a03f-6ee393e170f7
